title: Kimi K2.5: Visual Agentic Intelligence
description: Simon Willison analyzes Kimi K2.5, examining new developments in visual agentic AI capabilities and their implications for software development workflows. Explores how visual understanding is becoming integrated with agentic AI systems.
author: Simon Willison

title: One Human + One Agent = One Browser From Scratch
description: Case study examining how a single human working with one AI agent successfully built a browser from scratch, demonstrating the potential of human-AI collaboration for complex software projects. Shows that focused human guidance combined with AI agents can achieve remarkable results.
author: Simon Willison

title: The Verge: Claude Vibe-Coding for Smart Home Setup
description: The Verge reports on using Claude Code to set up Home Assistant smart home platform, highlighting how AI made complex platform setup simple and fast. Demonstrates practical applications of vibe coding for real-world development tasks.
author: The Verge

title: AI-Weekly Issue 201: Claude Code Impact
description: AI-Weekly newsletter discusses Claude Code's impact on software engineering and the rapidly evolving AI coding landscape in late January 2026.
author: AI-Weekly

title: Achieving 5x Agentic Coding Performance with Few-Shot Prompting
description: Towards Data Science article published 5 days ago covers how LLMs are incredibly useful tools for programmers and explores achieving 5x performance improvements with agentic coding using few-shot prompting techniques.
author: Towards Data Science

title: FastRender: A Browser Built by Thousands of Agents
description: Analysis of an ambitious project attempting to build a web browser using AI agents, exploring the practical challenges and successes of large-scale autonomous coding efforts. Examines whether thousands of coordinated AI agents can successfully complete complex software projects.
author: Simon Willison (analyzing Wilson Lin's work)

title: Cursor's OpenAI-Powered Agents Built and Ran a Browser
description: Fortune coverage of Cursor using a swarm of AI agents powered by OpenAI to build and run a web browser for an entire week without human assistance, demonstrating significant progress in autonomous agent capabilities. This represents a milestone in long-running autonomous coding.
author: Fortune

title: Hacker News: AI2 Open Coding Agents
description: Hacker News discussion from 1 day ago about AI2 Open Coding Agents. Key insight: 'An agent has three elements: intelligence (LLM), autonomy (loop) and tools to do anything interesting/useful.' Community discussion on agent architecture.
author: Hacker News Community

title: Hacker News: yolo-cage - AI Coding Agent Security
description: Show HN post about yolo-cage, a system for AI coding agents that prevents data exfiltration. Discussion on security concerns with LLM agents, noting that LLM agents 'will take to workaround any instructed limitations' and potential risks from malicious actors.
author: Hacker News Community

title: Last Week in AI — January 19–26, 2026
description: Medium newsletter covering recent AI developments including mentions of autonomous coding agents building browsers and the rapid evolution of AI coding capabilities in January 2026.
author: Jonathan Fulton

title: ArXiv cs.AI Recent Submissions
description: ArXiv's artificial intelligence category showing active research submissions from January 22-28, 2026, including papers on machine learning, AI agents, and related topics. Recent submissions from Wed Jan 28 through Thu Jan 22.
author: ArXiv Community

title: ArXiv cs.LG Recent Submissions
description: ArXiv's machine learning category showing active research submissions from January 22-28, 2026, featuring recent work on AI, ML algorithms, and applications. Recent submissions from Wed Jan 28 through Thu Jan 22.
author: ArXiv Community
